name: FALCON 16 (MCVAY)
notes:
The FALCON 16 was said to have been designed around 1954 by G. William McVay, who began building most boats somewhat later when he formed his own company, until it closed during the mid 1970's.  Paceship Yachts also built the boat for a few years, beginning in the early 1960's.
The FALCON was raced as one design class for a number of years in New England in the mid 1960's.
Thanks to Falcon owner Joseph Haley for providing corrections and photo.
